title: Indonesia Says Sriwijaya Air Flight Loses Contact With Air-Traffic Control
sub_head: Boeing passenger jet was on domestic flight from Jakarta
body:
A Sriwijaya Air Boeing passenger plane lost contact with Indonesian authorities after taking off from the country’s capital Jakarta on Saturday, a government official said.
The domestic flight was headed from Jakarta to Pontianak, the capital of West Kalimantan province on Indonesia’s Borneo island, and went missing at 2:40 p.m. local time, according to Indonesian Transportation Ministry spokeswoman Adita Irawati.
Ms. Irawati said an investigation was under way. Sriwijaya Air, which is an Indonesian carrier, also said it was investigating the matter.
Indonesia’s military said it was conducting a search-and-rescue mission with ships and helicopter in relation to the Sriwijaya flight.
Write to Jon Emont at jonathan.emont@wsj.com
